units.title: Human material and informed consent
units.text: Human material and informed consent. The organoid lines used in this study were derived from biopsies (provided by Departments of Surgery and Pathology of the Diakonessenhuis hospital, Utrecht, The Netherlands) of a CRC and adjacent healthy colon mucosal epithelium taken from colon tissue resected during a left hemicolectomy to remove a CRC from a female patient (71 years of age). Tissue collection was approved by the medical ethical committee (METC) of the Diakonessenhuis hospital, in agreement with the declaration of Helsinki and according to Dutch and European Union legislation. The samples were collected under METC protocol 12/093 HUB-Cancer following written informed consent at the Diakonessenhuis hospital Utrecht.
units.rationale: Specifies ethical approval and source of biological material.

units.title: Organoid generation and crypt isolation
units.text: Organoid generation and cultures. Colonic epithelial organoid lines were derived as previously described56,57. Briefly, crypts of the healthy portion of the colonic epithelium (at least 10 cm away from the tumor side) were isolated by digestion of the intestinal mucosa in chelation solution (5.6 mM Na2HPO4, 8.0 mM KH2PO4, 96.2 mM NaCl, 1.6 mM KCl, 43.4 mM Sucrose, and 54.9 mM D‑Sorbitol, Sigma) supplemented with dithiotreitol (0.5 mM, Sigma) and EDTA (2 mM, in‑house) for 30 min at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Describes the isolation of colonic crypts for organoid culture.

units.title: Plating crypts and culture medium composition
units.text: Colonic crypts were subsequently plated in basement membrane extract (BME; Cultrex PC BME RGF type 2, Amsbio). Organoids were grown in human intestinal stem cell medium (HISCM), which is composed of Advanced Dulbecco’s modified Eagle medium/F12 supplemented with penicillin/streptomycin, 10 mM HEPES and Glutamax (all Gibco, Thermo Fisher Scientific) with 50% Wnt3a conditioned medium (in‑house), 20% R‑Spondin1 conditioned medium (in‑house), 10% Noggin conditioned medium (in‑house), 1× B27, 1.25 mM N‑acetylcysteine, 10 mM nicotinamide, 50 ng/ml human EGF, 10 nM Gastrin, 500 nM A83‑01, 3 µM SB202190, 10 nM prostaglandin E2 and 100 µg/ml Primocin (Invivogen).
units.rationale: Provides the plating method and detailed composition of the growth medium.

units.title: Tumor biopsy digestion into single cells
units.text: Tumor biopsies were digested into single cells using collagenase II (1 mg/ml, Gibco, Thermo Fisher Scientific), supplemented with hyaluronidase (10 µg/ml) and LY27632 (10 µM) for 30 min at 37 °C while shaking.
units.rationale: Details enzymatic dissociation of tumor tissue to obtain single cells.

units.title: Seeding dissociated tumor cells
units.text: Dissociated tumor cells were plated in BME and organoids were cultured in HICS minus Wnt conditioned medium supplemented with 10 µM LY27632 at 37 °C.
units.rationale: Specifies the plating and culture conditions for tumor‑derived organoids.

units.title: Ligand intensity comparison
units.text: Ligand intensities from each tumor organoid clone were compared by retention time alignment and label‑free quantification in a pair‑wise manner.
units.rationale: Outlines the analytical approach for comparing peptide ligand levels.

units.title: Peptide intensity quantification
units.text: For each peptide, normalized peptide intensities were summed from three replicated measurements by HCD (Exp 1), or EThcD (Exp 2), respectively.
units.rationale: Describes how peptide intensities were aggregated across replicates.

units.title: Statistical analysis of protein abundance
units.text: Significant changes in protein abundance with respect to normal colon organoids were determined based on three technical replicates with a two‑sided student’s t test: *p < 0.05; **p < 0.01.
units.rationale: Specifies the statistical test and significance thresholds used.

units.title: Data presentation and plotting
units.text: Data presented as mean values ± standard deviation. Plotting data tabulated in Source Data.
units.rationale: Indicates how results were summarized and visualized.
